page.title: 04BARNABY FAIR
page.content: Barnaby Fair is a tradition that happens every year in the month of June.It has been happening for generations and nobody really knows the exact day or date it started. Several hundreds of Gipsies come selling horses of different breeds, sizes and colours.They are auctioned at Boroughbridge market in a field. We have a road called Horsefair and Gipsies used to run up and down with the horses. Gipsies also sell pots and pans, pegs,scissors and horse tack.They read some peoples palms hoping in return that they will buy something. In 1862 barnaby Fair was created by Charles 2nd royal Charter.Gipsies used to stay for about a fortnight but now they quickly move in and out.
